entries.meaning: (linguistics) In Arabic and Hebrew - supplying the vowels (diacritics), normally not written to show the correct pronunciation, used in dictionaries, children's books, religious texts and textbooks for learners. Arabic terms: tashkiil (تشكيل‎), taHriik (تحريك‎) - (action of supplying the vowel points), also known as ḥarakāt (حركات‎ — the singular is ḥaraka حركة‎) - (the diacritical marks), Hebrew term: ניקוד‎ nikud.
